feed.title: The Oliynyk Lab
feed.subtitle: In our lab, we explore intermetallicsâ€”compounds where metals and metalloids intersect. Our mission? To discover novel compounds, unravel their crystal structures, and see just how far these materials can go. By combining cutting-edge syntheses, characterization, and machine learning, we're pushing the boundaries of materials science, one intermetallic at a time.

entry.title: Visit from our Bronx Science Students

link.title: Visit from our Bronx Science Students

entry.content:
We recently had the pleasure of welcoming our volunteer researchers from Bronx Science High School - Yujing, Joseph, and Brandon to the lab. Their visit was filled with curiosity, hands-on learning, and meaningful contributions to our ongoing projects.

During their time with us, the students worked remotely on specific computational tasks, such as implementing PC/PLS-DA for crystal structure classification (Yujing), Pymatgen for polyhedra identification (Brandon), and SISSO for ML techniques (Joseph)!

Here are some highlights from their visit:

Students gathered around the arc-melter

Yujing operating the arc-melter

Emil demonstrating the thermoelectric effect

Emil demonstrating the scanning electron microscope

Bala demonstrating the XRD

We are grateful for the energy and enthusiasm Yujing, Joseph, and Brandon brought to the lab. Their visit was a wonderful reminder of the importance of mentorship and the excitement of scientific exploration. We look forward to seeing all they accomplish in the future!
entry.summary: We recently had the pleasure of welcoming our volunteer researchers from Bronx Science High School - Yujing, Joseph, and Brandon to the lab. Their visit was filled with curiosity, hands-on learning, and meaningful contributions to our ongoing projects.

entry.title: 2025 ACS MARM
entry.content:
We are excited to share that our group members participated in the 2025 ACS MARM at Seton Hall University! Several of our students presented their research projects at the conference, including Emil and Danila with presentations, as well as Bala, Mariam, Sviatoslav, and Natalia with their own posters! The full technical program can be found here!

Presentations and Posters:

Mariam - Poster

Natalia - Poster

Sviatoslav - Poster

Danila - Presentation

Emil - Presentation

Congratulations to everyone who presented and represented our group!
entry.summary: We are excited to share that our group members participated in the 2025 ACS MARM at Seton Hall University! Several of our students presented their research projects at the conference, including Emil and Danila with presentations, as well as Bala, Mariam, Sviatoslav, and Natalia with their own posters! The full technical program can be found here!

entry.title: 2025 Hunter Undergraduate Research Symposium
entry.content:
We are excited to share that our group members participated in the 2025 Hunter Undergraduate Research Symposium! Several of our students presented their research projects at the symposium, including Brook and Natalia with posters and presentations, as well as Danila, Sviatoslav and Anna with their own posters culminating a years worth of great work!

Presentations and Posters:

Brook & Natalia - Presentation

Anna - Poster

Danila - Poster

Natalia - Poster

Sviatoslav - Poster

Congratulations to everyone who presented and represented our group!
entry.summary: We are excited to share that our group members participated in the 2025 Hunter Undergraduate Research Symposium! Several of our students presented their research projects at the symposium, including Brook and Natalia with posters and presentations, as well as Danila, Sviatoslav and Anna with their own posters culminating a years worth of great work!
